p: Key contributions to this literature are, among others, Colin Macleod, “Liberal Equality and the Affective Family,” in David Archard and Colin Macleod, eds., The Moral and Political Status of Children, (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2002), pp. 212-230; Harry Brighouse and Adam Swift, “Parents’ Rights and the Value of the Family,” Ethics, Vol. 117, No. 1, (2006), pp. 80-108; Christine Overall, Why Have Children? The Ethical Debate, (Cambridge: MIT Press, 2012); Anca Gheaus, ‘The Right to Parent One’s Biological Baby,” Journal of Political Philosophy, Vol. 20, No. 4, (2012), pp. 432-455; Harry Brighouse and Adam Swift, Family Values (Princeton: Princeton University Press, 2014); Rivka Weinberg, The Risk of a Lifetime: How, When, and Why Procreaton May be Permissible, (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2015); Anca Gheaus, “The right to parent and duties concerning future generations,” Journal of Political Philosophy, Vol. 24, No. 4, (2016), pp. 487-508; Tina Rulli, “Preferring a Genetically-Related Child,” Journal of Moral Philosophy, Vol. 13, No. 6, (2016), pp. 669-698; Luara Ferracioli, “Procreative-Parenting, Love’s Reasons and the Demands of Morality,” The Philosophical Quarterly, Vol. 68, No. 270, (2018), pp. 77-97.
